items.title: Nykaa, Paytm among six additions in MSCI India index; Tata Elxsi, CONCOR out
items.description: MSCI’s November 2025 semi-annual review has triggered major reshuffles across its India indices, with Nykaa and Paytm entering the MSCI India Standard Index alongside Fortis Healthcare, GE Vernova T&D India, Indian Bank and Siemens Energy India. Three stocks—Astral, CONCOR and Tata Elxsi—have been removed. The smallcap index saw a deeper churn with 7 additions and 33 deletions.

items.title: IndiGo shares in focus as airline returns to loss in Q2. Should investors hit sell?
items.description: InterGlobe Aviation, parent of IndiGo, reported a Q2FY26 net loss of Rs 2,582 crore, reversing from a profit of Rs 2,176 crore in Q1. Revenue rose 9% YoY to Rs 18,555 crore, but rising costs and forex losses pressured margins. Brokerage Nuvama maintains a ‘Hold’ rating with a target of Rs 5,330, citing cautious outlook despite strong passenger growth.

items.title: TBO Tek, Dabur India among 6 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
items.description: On November 4, six Nifty500 stocks that gained over 2% appeared in the RSI Trending Up scan, according to data from StockEdge.com. An uptrend signal is generated when the RSI value crosses above 50 from below. “RSI trending up” indicates that the Relative Strength Index is rising, suggesting strengthening price momentum. This may point to potential upward movement and help traders identify buying opportunities.

items.title: Paytm shares under spotlight after 98% YoY fall in Q2 profit; Citi sets Rs 1,500 target
items.description: Paytm (One 97 Communications) reported a steep 98% YoY drop in Q2FY26 net profit to Rs 21 crore, mainly due to a one-time Rs 190 crore impairment charge. Excluding this, PAT was Rs 211 crore. Revenue rose 24% YoY to Rs 2,061 crore, with strong growth in payments and financial services. Citi maintains a ‘Buy’ rating with a Rs 1,500 target.

items.title: Last day to buy HUL, Dabur, and 16 other stocks to be eligible for dividends
items.description: November 6 is the last day to buy shares of Hindustan Unilever Ltd (HUL), Dabur India, Shriram Finance, and 16 other companies to qualify for their interim dividends. The ex-date for all these stocks is November 7, 2025. Dividend payouts range from Rs 0.1 to Rs 75 per share, offering investors an opportunity to earn returns ahead of the ex-date.

items.title: Positive Breakout: 10 stocks close above their 200 DMAs
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, 10 stocks saw their closing prices cross above their 200-day moving average (DMA) on November 4, 2025, according to technical scan data from stockedge.com. The 200-day DMA is widely used by traders as a key indicator to determine the broader trend of a stock. As long as a stock trades above its 200-day DMA on the daily timeframe, it is generally considered to be in an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Wall Street girds for life under Mamdani, worries about New York City's competitiveness
items.description: New York City's financial sector braces for a new era with Mayor Zohran Mamdani's election. Business leaders express apprehension about potential impacts on the city's competitiveness and appeal. While some hope for moderation, others worry about proposed tax hikes and rent controls.  The city's economic future under Mamdani's leadership is now a key focus.

items.title: Fewer karats brighten up Tanishq, give Titan lustre
items.description: Titan Company is poised for continued strong performance throughout the fiscal year, fueled by robust festive and wedding demand. Initiatives like offering lower karat jewelry and strategic international expansion, including the Damas Jewellery acquisition, are driving growth. Analysts are revising estimates upwards, reflecting confidence in Titan's sustained momentum.

items.title: Top brokerages see up to 20% upside for SBI stock in a year
items.description: State Bank of India shares surged following strong September-quarter results, with analysts upgrading price targets and projecting a 7-20% upside. The bank's profit after tax rose 10% year-on-year, beating estimates, and asset quality improved. This performance has attracted renewed investor interest in public sector banks.

items.title: Gift Nifty rises over 50 pts; here's the trading setup for the day
items.description: Indian equities closed lower amid persistent FII outflows, with market direction hinging on Q2 earnings and global macro signals. Positive US-India trade talks could boost sentiment and export-linked sectors. The rupee recovered, gaining 7 paise against the dollar, supported by a correction in global crude oil prices.

items.title: HUL’s unusual promise read our contract with our new CEO
items.description: Hindustan Unilever Limited's notice for Priya Nair's appointment as CEO included an unusual offer: shareholders could obtain a copy of her CEO agreement via email. While not legally mandated, this move goes beyond typical inspection procedures, sparking debate on transparency versus competitive risks in executive contracts.

items.title: M&M set to exit RBL via $78-million block deal
items.description: Mahindra & Mahindra is set to exit RBL Bank by selling its entire 3.5% stake. The deal is valued at approximately $78 million. Kotak Securities is managing the transaction. The sale is scheduled for Thursday. This move represents a profitable exit for Mahindra, which had invested in the bank in July 2023.

items.title: Weddings, festivals bring joie de vivre to jewellery stocks
items.description: Jewellery stocks are experiencing a rally driven by robust festive demand and the upcoming wedding season, despite higher gold and silver prices. Analysts anticipate continued momentum, with strong quarterly results and shifting consumer preferences towards modern designs supporting sales and margins. While near-term outlook remains positive, potential moderation in gains is expected after the recent surge.

items.title: Emirates NBD proposes open offer to acquire 26% in RBL
items.description: Emirates NBD Bank plans to acquire a 26% stake in RBL Bank via an open offer at ₹280 per share, totaling ₹11,636 crore. This move, part of a larger $3 billion investment to gain a majority stake, marks a significant FDI in India's banking sector. RBL Bank is seeking an increased FDI limit to facilitate the transaction.

items.title: Desi Money Dominates: DII holdings hit record as foreign ownership sinks to 13-year low
items.description: Domestic institutional investors' holdings in Indian stocks reached an all-time high in the September quarter, widening the gap with overseas investors to a 25-year peak. While local funds, fueled by retail inflows, continued to invest, foreign investors sold shares amid growth and valuation concerns, preferring other markets.

items.title: Stocks in news: Paytm, IndiGo, M&M, RIL, LIC, TCS, Apollo Hospitals
items.description: Markets closed lower on the weekly expiry day, with the Nifty 50 slipping 0.7% to 25,600, retesting its 20-day EMA. Several companies like Paytm, IndiGo, and M&M are in focus due to Q2 results and news developments, impacting trading sentiment.

items.title: Groww IPO Day 2: Check what top 10 brokerages said before investing in this Rs 6,632 crore issue
items.description: Groww’s Rs 6,632 crore IPO, which saw 57% subscription on Day 1, has received a wave of positive recommendations from leading brokerages. Most analysts rated the issue as "Subscribe," citing Groww’s leadership in India’s retail investing market, robust tech stack, and long-term potential despite steep valuations.

items.title: Hindalco shares drop 6% after Novelis flags $550–650 million cash flow hit from New York plant fire
items.description: Hindalco Industries shares fell over 6% after its US subsidiary Novelis said a fire at its New York plant will dent FY26 free cash flow by up to $650 million and EBITDA by $150 million.

items.title: Last day to buy BPCL, NTPC shares to qualify for interim dividends. Do you own?
items.description: Investors must buy BPCL and NTPC shares today, 6 November, to be eligible for their interim dividends of Rs 7.5 and Rs 2.75 per share, respectively.

items.title: Booming market! 10 data center stocks that could catch the tailwind and jump up to 58%
items.description: India’s data centre story could turn into one of the biggest structural investment themes. Rising internet traffic, AI adoption, and the government’s push for data localisation are driving capacity expansion, with brokerages spotting big upside in select stocks. Here are five names linked to the theme that analysts believe could deliver meaningful gains.

items.title: Stocks to buy in 2025 for long term: GAIL, Gland Pharma among 5 stocks that could give 12-30% return
items.description: Brokerages remain upbeat on select banking, infrastructure, and pharmaceutical names, highlighting earnings recovery, margin improvement, and growth visibility across sectors.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other source

items.title: Britannia Industries shares jump 5% as Q2 net profit rises 23% to Rs 655 crore; Nuvama maintains Buy
items.description: Britannia Industries’ Q2 profit rose 23% YoY to Rs 655 crore, driven by cost control and stable commodity prices. The company also appointed Rakshit Hargave as its new CEO.

items.title: Delhivery shares plunge over 8% after reporting Q2 loss, leadership shake-up
items.description: Delhivery shares: Delhivery's shares dropped 8.5% after the logistics firm reported a Rs 50.38 crore net loss in Q2 FY26, despite record shipment volumes and revenue growth. The company also announced a CFO transition, with Vivek Pabari set to take over from Amit Agarwal in January 2026.

items.title: Sensex climbs over 300 points, Nifty tops 25,600 as earnings boost investor mood
items.description: Indian stocks surged on Thursday, led by strong quarterly results from Sun Pharma and Britannia. The inclusion of four Indian firms in the MSCI index further boosted sentiment, with major indices seeing gains. While broader markets remained flat, specific stocks like Paytm also experienced significant upward movement, attracting foreign investment interest.

items.title: Grasim Industries shares fall 4% after reporting Q2 results. Should you buy the dip?
items.description: Grasim Industries shares: The company reported a 76% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit for Q2 FY26 to ₹553.48 crore, up from ₹314.63 crore a year earlier.

items.title: Hitachi Energy among 5 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
items.description: As of 4 November, there was a notable surge in futures open interest for nine stocks in the NSE F&O pack, contributing to a total increase in open interest of over 5% as compared to the previous trade. A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security. This uptrend reflects an increasing number of participants either initiating new positions or expanding the size of their existing positions within the futures market.

items.title: Sun Pharma shares in focus after muted Q2 earnings. Nuvama maintains hold with Rs 1,800 target
items.description: Sun Pharma will be in focus after reporting a Q2 FY26 net profit of Rs 3,117.95 crore, up 2.6% YoY, with revenue rising 8.6% to Rs 14,405 crore. Innovative Medicines drove growth, surpassing U.S. generics for the first time. EBITDA rose 14.9% with strong margins. Nuvama maintained a ‘Hold’ rating, citing competition risks and potential U.S. policy headwinds.

items.title: RBL Bank shares in focus as M&M sells entire 3.45% stake via Rs 678 crore block deal: Report
items.description: RBL Bank shares will be in focus on Thursday after a large block deal saw Mahindra & Mahindra likely sell its entire 3.45% stake for about Rs 678 crore at Rs 321 per share, according to reports. M&M had invested at Rs 197 in 2023, making this a 63% return. The company had earlier indicated no plans to raise its stake above 9.9%.

items.title: City Union Bank among 5 stocks that witnessed 5-year swing high breakout
items.description: In the Nifty500 pack, five stocks witnessed a 5-year swing high at the close on November 4, suggesting bullishness in counters, according to stockedge.com's technical scan data.A 5-year swing high represents the highest price a stock has reached within a five-year timeframe. This level acts as a significant resistance point where the price has historically struggled to go beyond. This occurrence may be seen as a bullish sign, indicating the potential for further upward movement in the stock. However, it's worth noting that this is different from a 5-year breakout, which occurs when a stock's price surpasses a key resistance level that has held for five years or longer.

items.title: Motilal Oswal initiates ‘Buy’ on Waaree Energies, sets Rs 4,000 target price on scale, integration strength
items.description: Motilal Oswal initiated coverage on Waaree Energies with a ‘Buy’ rating and Rs 4,000 target, citing strong capacity expansion, integration across the solar value chain, and robust renewable energy growth outlook.

items.title: Asian Paints shares rally 6%. Here are 4 reasons behind the surge today
items.description: Asian Paints shares surged after the sudden resignation of Birla Opus CEO Rakshit Hargave, who is set to become CEO of Britannia Industries from December 15. The move stirred investor sentiment as Birla Opus, the Aditya Birla Group’s paint venture and Asian Paints’ key rival, faces a leadership vacuum just 18 months after its launch.

items.title: Motilal Oswal, Nuvama cut Suzlon share target price despite 538% YoY PAT jump in Q2FY26. Here’s what triggered the cuts
items.description: Suzlon Energy posted a 538% YoY jump in Q2FY26 profit to Rs 1,279 crore, its best in 30 years. Despite strong earnings, Motilal Oswal and Nuvama cut target prices citing valuation resets and moderated long-term growth expectations.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei rises more than 1% as Wall Street rebound restores risk appetite
items.description: Japan's Nikkei share average surged over 1% on Thursday, recovering from Wednesday's sharp losses, as a strong Wall Street performance boosted investor confidence.  Advantest and SoftBank Group led the gains, though Tokyo Electron dipped.  Konica Minolta jumped significantly after raising its profit forecast, while Nippon Steel fell on a projected profit decline.

items.title: Adani Power shares to rally 17% from current levels? Morgan Stanley lists 4 reasons
items.description: Morgan Stanley raised Adani Power’s target price to Rs 185, citing strong earnings visibility, new PPAs, and capacity expansion. The brokerage expects a 20% EBITDA CAGR over FY25–FY33, backed by a robust balance sheet and regulatory clarity. Adani Power’s 41.9 GW portfolio positions it to gain from India’s rising power demand.

items.title: Multibaggers: 5 Nifty500 stocks that doubled in just 7 months – Are you invested?
items.description: In just seven months of FY26, the Indian stock market has offered investors an exhilarating ride, with a handful of Nifty500 stocks stealing the spotlight. While the benchmark Nifty index recorded a steady 9% rise, its broader counterpart, the Nifty500, outperformed with an 11% gain. But the numbers only tell part of the story. Behind the headline figures, nearly half of the Nifty500 — around 250 stocks — have delivered double-digit returns to investors.A closer look at the rally reveals 14 standout performers that have surged between 70% and 140%, navigating global uncertainties and market volatility with remarkable resilience. Most impressive of all, five of these market leaders have more than doubled investors’ wealth, climbing over 100% in just over seven months — yet three of them still trade double digits below their 52-week highs. (Data Source: ACE Equity)

items.title: State Bank Of India among 5 stocks that hit 52-week highs; gained up to 16% in a month
items.description: On Thursday, the benchmark Sensex slipped by around 148 points to close at 83,311. Despite the broader market decline, five stocks from the BSE 200 Index reached their 52-week highs — marking their highest levels in a year. Such breakouts are generally viewed by traders and investors as bullish signals, suggesting strong upward momentum and the possibility of further gains.

items.title: 'Sometimes, we see bubbles': Big short Michael Burry’s bearish bet on world's most valuable stock meets global AI sell-off
items.description: Michael Burry’s Scion Asset Management has taken massive short positions on Nvidia and Palantir, signalling caution over the AI boom as global tech stocks face their sharpest decline in months.

items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex slips 148 pts, Nifty below 25,550 as financial, metal stocks drag
items.description: Indian stocks ended lower on Thursday. Early gains were erased as investors took a break. Financial and metal stocks saw declines. The Sensex and Nifty both fell. Midcap and small-cap shares experienced steeper selling. This marks a second consecutive session of losses for the major indices.

items.title: Nomura upgrades Asian Paints, Berger Paints to Buy. Here’s why analysts are turning bullish
items.description: Nomura upgraded Asian Paints and Berger Paints to ‘Buy’, noting that the worst of competition from Birla Opus is over. The brokerage raised target prices, citing resilient margins, stable growth outlook, and limited disruption despite heavy new entrant investment.

items.title: 330% returns in 3 years: Mukul Agrawal-backed multibagger Ajmera Realty declares 1:5 stock split
items.description: Ajmera Realty & Infra, backed by ace investor Mukul Agrawal, announced a 1:5 stock split after delivering 336% returns in three years. The multibagger’s Q2 profit fell 14% YoY to Rs 30 crore, while revenue rose 10% amid steady long-term growth.

items.title: Pine Labs IPO opens tomorrow: GMP among 10 things you should know before investing in this fintech
items.description: India’s leading fintech company Pine Labs will open its Rs 3,900 crore IPO for public subscription on November 7. The issue comes amid moderate market sentiment, though the grey market premium (GMP) of 7% suggests decent listing expectations. Here’s everything you need to know before investing.

items.title: For investors with more than a 2-year framework: 5 large-cap stocks from different sectors with an upside potential of up to 36%
items.description: In the last four years, a number of companies have been listed in the market. From a disappointing Paytm to a Zomato, all of them have been treated differently by the street. What is the reason for this differential treatment? One difference might appear to be the valuations. Yes, but the bigger reason is something else. There is a big opportunity to make wealth if you pick the right business. Mind you, we are not saying the right stock, but the right business. And a business is much more than just its stock price.

items.title: SBI to launch IPO for SBI Funds Management, plans to divest 6.3% stake
items.description: State Bank of India plans to sell a 6.3% stake in its asset management arm, SBI Funds Management Limited. This divestment will be carried out through an Initial Public Offering. The approval for this move was granted by the Executive Committee of the Central Board. The entire process is anticipated to conclude in 2026.

items.title: Redington shares soar 14% as Q2 profit jumps 32% YoY to Rs 388 crore; revenue up 17%
items.description: Redington's stock soared over 14% following its record quarterly results, fueled by a 17% revenue jump to Rs 29,118 crore and a 32% net profit increase to Rs 388 crore.  Strong growth across all segments, particularly Software Solutions, highlights the company's evolving role as a comprehensive technology solutions platform, enabling digital transformation for enterprises.

items.title: Anil Ambani group stocks Reliance Power, Reliance Infra and others slide up to 5%. What’s behind the drop?
items.description: Anil Ambani group stocks, including Reliance Power and Reliance Infrastructure, tumbled up to 5% after the SFIO launched a fresh probe into alleged fund diversion and governance lapses. The action follows earlier investigations by the ED, CBI, and Sebi, deepening regulatory scrutiny of the debt-laden group.

items.title: Orkla India shares slip below IPO price after listing. Good entry point for investors?
items.description: Orkla India shares listed at Rs 750, about 2.7% above the issue price, before slipping below IPO levels. Analysts say the flat debut offers a good entry point for long-term investors, citing strong brands like MTR and Eastern, steady growth, and rising demand for packaged foods.

items.title: Markets decide share price, Sebi not to intervene in setting valuations: Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey
items.description: Sebi Chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey stated that capital markets, not the regulator, determine IPO share prices, addressing concerns over high valuations like Lenskart Solutions. He emphasized Sebi's role in ensuring robust disclosures. Pandey also urged companies to make ESG commitments authentic and measurable, not just for branding, and to institutionalize ethics through board oversight.

items.title: Singtel to sell 0.8% Bharti Airtel stake in Rs 10,300 crore block deal: Report
items.description: Singtel is reportedly selling a 0.8% stake in Bharti Airtel for Rs 10,300 crore, a move aligning with its strategy to optimize holdings and unlock capital. This comes as Bharti Airtel reports robust Q2 performance, with strong EBITDA growth and rising ARPU, signaling continued positive momentum for the Indian telecom giant.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Redington, Paytm among 6 stocks that moved most on Thursday
Valuation check: 9 stocks trading above Industry PE benchmarks
items.description: When a company's Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio is above the industry average, it typically indicates that the stock is valued higher than its peers in the same industry. In the Nifty500 pack, we highlight the top nine stocks whose trailing twelve-month P/E ratio is higher than the industry P/E, based on the StockEdge valuation scan.This could mean investors are willing to pay a premium for the stock, often due to expectations of higher growth, strong performance, or confidence in the company’s prospects. However, it can also suggest that the stock might be overvalued or that the market is overestimating its potential compared to other companies in the industry.

items.title: Stock Radar: MRPL hits fresh 52-week high in November 2025; will the rally continue?
items.description: Mangalore Refinery & Petrochemicals Ltd (MRPL) has broken out of its consolidation phase to touch a fresh 52-week high of Rs 176 in November 2025. The stock, which has surged over 40% in the last three months, is trading above key moving averages. Analysts suggest medium-term traders with a high-risk appetite can target Rs 240 in the next 4–5 months, with support seen near Rs 115.
